inn1.comm: Panyangara's loosener is not quick, but it is bang on target. Shaping in to middle and off, and Porterfield leans forward to defend.
Porterfield gets himself in a bit of a tangle looking to tuck this one to leg, and the ball pops uppishly towards midwicket. Well short though.
he's also got Wellington Masakadza at point, and the newest member of Zimbabwe's squad rushes in to stop this nudge off the back foot.
this has kept slightly low outside off, Porterfield leaving well alone. It was wide enough that the stumps were never in danger, despite the low bounce.
nicely accurate from Panyangara, giving Porterfield no width with a length ball on middle. Defended back down the track.
now there is bounce! Is the track slightly two-paced? Again Porterfield raised his arms to leave, but this one leapt up and Mutumbami took it at head height.
Jongwe hits a length outside off, the ball seaming in to the right-handed Stirling. But it's wide of off stump, and left alone.
leading edge! This was the outswinger, and Stirling was perhaps too early into his clip to leg. But the ball drops well short of extra cover.
back of a length, and curving gently away outside off. Stirling stands tall and gets off the mark with a firm push through cover point.
a straighter line from Jongwe, but a similar length. Stirling goes back and across to defend.
Stirling checks his straight drive on a full delivery, and the ball scoots straight back down the track, hitting the non-striker's stumps.
Stirling flicks to leg this time, but he's found midwicket.
too full from Panyangara, and Porterfield leans into a beautiful cover drive. Williams dives, but he can't cut it off at mid-off.
good response from the bowler! This delivery has a little more vim behind it, and it lifts past the left-hander's outside edge.
and again. This delivery is even better. Porterfield had to play at it, propping forward, but it jags away off the seam and he's comprehensively beaten.
the left-hander decides not to play at this one outside off stump.
Panyangara is finding significant movement off the track with the new ball, getting it to leave the left-hander. Porterfield shoulders arms once more.

Porterfield punches back! There's a good battle between these two. Panyangara's last ball is too full, and again Porterfield meets it with a flowing drive. The placement is superb, right between cover and mid-off.
full and straight from Jongwe, and Stirling clips to midwicket.
Stirling steps forward to drive, but doesn't come close to timing the shot and the ball trickles slowly to mid-off.
this one pops up off a length to get Stirling hopping in defence
just short of a good length, outside off, and Stirling rotates the strike with a glide down to third man.
Jongwe shoots one across Porterfield's bows, and the Ireland captain raises his arms to leave. There's some juice in the wicket when the bowlers really bend their backs.
Porterfield gets up on his toes to defend, dropping the ball at his feet, and the fielder is in too quickly to allow a run.
just a little too straight from Panyangara, and Stirling tickles him down to fine leg.

an edge? No! Panyangara hit that troublesome length outside off and Porterfield pushed at it, the ball scooting past the bat. The keeper and slips went up straight away, but Panyangara didn't seem convincing in his appeal.
fuller this time, and Porterfield drives, but hits the field. It's the first time he's missed out on the drive.
seaming away outside off, and Porterfield leaves it alone.
good pace and carry for Zimbabwe's burly fast bowler! Porterfield leaves, and the ball slaps hard into Mutumbami's gloves, above his head.
driven once more, but Zimbabwe have adjusted their angles slightly and Porterfield can't find the gap he's looking for. The ball goes straight to Raza at extra cover.
good length from Jongwe, and Stirling presses half forward in defence.
on a length, and seaming in off the track. Stirling walks into a defensive push.
past the outside edge! Jongwe gets one to hold its line outside off. Stirling was expecting that inward movement again, and played inside it.
this wasn't all that short, but Stirling has flung himself into a front-foot pull. It's not the best looking shot, and it isn't very well timed either.
full outside off, and Porterfield drives square. Wellington Masakadza sprints to his left from point to cut it off.
a good length delivery, angled across the left-hander, is left well alone.

well, he's got four but again Stirling isn't quite in position for the shot. He walks down at Panyangara and the ball skews off the outer half of the bat, flying just over mid-off and down to the boundary.
a similar delivery, but this one is met with a more orthodox drive and the ball rolls to cover.
nicely driven from Stirling. He looks much better when he keeps the ball along the ground. But the placement sends the ball straight to the mid-off fielder.
straighter from Panyangara, and Stirling's glance to leg goes straight to Raza at midwicket.
rising off a length, on off stump, and Stirling's push goes straight to the lone cover fielder.
a little bit of seam movement means the ball takes the inside edge of an uncertain poke from the crease. The ball goes nowhere, landing at the batsman's feet.

Porterfield falls to a tumbling catch at second slip! This delivery was angled right across him, and Porterfield just pushed at it from the crease. The ball took a thick edge, and Ervine held a clean catch tumbling to his left in the slips. First breakthrough for Zimbabwe, and it's the reward for some consistent bowling.
Jongwe continues to hit that good length, and Joyce shuffles across to defend from the crease.
a shade fuller from Jongwe, and Joyce props half forward to defend to point.
Jongwe looks a different bowler from the last match. Again he hits a good length, just outside off, and the left-hander responds watchfully. Metronomic stuff.

ah, shoddy fielding down at third man. Joyce flashed at this delivery, which was a little fuller, and the edge flew through the vacant gully region. It should only have been one run down to third man, but Panyangara runs over the ball as he comes in from that position and it's four.
normal service resumes, Jongwe zoning in on a good length outside off, and Joyce defending.

short and wide outside off, and Stirling flings everything into a full-blooded cut. The ball flies in the air, but not out of the middle and some tag-team work from Mutumbodzi and Masakadza on the point boundary keeps them to three.
full and wide, angling wider off the seam, and Joyce slashes at the ball. He doesn't get all of it, and Jongwe at third man fields the ball.
tip and run cricket, Stirling driving to mid-on and calling immediately. Williams aims a shy at the stumps from that position, but it goes wide.
an unconvincing poke off the back foot, and Joyce is beaten by the seam movement. Panyangara thinks for a moment that he's got his man.
a little fuller this time, and Joyce gets forward to push to cover.
past the edge again! This ball took off from a length, beating the top edge of Joyce's cut. Mutumbami holds it at head height.
hurled down the leg side, Stirling doesn't touch it and that's wide
Jongwe has an away swinger to go with his seam movement in to the right-hander. He applies the former to this delivery, but it's wide of off and left alone.

edged between keeper and slip! Stirling poked flat-footed from the crease at one that went away from him, but the ball flew right between the keeper and Nyumbu, who's at a wide first slip. Either of them could have gone for it, neither did.
that will smart a bit. Shorter and wider from Jongwe, and Stirling absolutely middles his cut shot, in front of square. The first one he's really middled today.
Jongwe is losing his radar in this over. This is full and on Stirling's legs, and he clips through the vacant square leg area.

through the covers this time! Too full from Jongwe, and Stirling leans into a cracking cover drive. It splits the field perfectly. It seems Jongwe is losing his concentration, and trying to do too much.
full and wide once more, but this one goes unpunished, Stirling's drive going straight to the extra cover fielder.
on a length, just outside off, and Joyce plays no stroke. If he can keep the ball there those slips might come into play.
but he doesn't, this is much too full and invites the drive from Joyce. The ball pings off the middle, and away for four through cover
Panyangara pulls his length back a bit, and Joyce withdraws his bat from the shot.
a slightly ungainly hack from the left-hander. He was aiming to thunder this through point, but it goes softly to the fielder, so badly was it timed.
a rising delivery outside off is left well alone.
and another watchful leave ends the over.
almost edged first ball! This left Stirling through the air, and further off the pitch. He stood at the crease and pushed at it, but didn't touch the ball.
this time Stirling gets right behind a defensive push, the ball rolling back to the bowler.
and again Chamu beats the outside edge. He's getting nice movement away from the right hander. Stirling plays inside a length delivery, Mutumbami collects.
full and straight from Chamu, and Stirling presses forward to defend the ball towards mid-on.
just short of a good length, and Stirling goes back and across to defend
a good end to an accurate, probing over. Full and just outside off. Stirling leans right over the ball and defends under his eyes.
Nyumbu also has a man out on the cover boundary, and Joyce cuts his first ball straight out to him.
a touch too short from Nyumbu, and Stirling shovels the ball out to deep square leg.
Nyumbu comes round the wicket to the left-hander, who leaves the ball alone outside off.
nicely flighted from Nyumbu. Joyce leans forward to defend in front of point, and they snatch a single to bring up Ireland's fifty.
Stirling stays back in his crease to push the ball to Raza at midwicket.
a paddle sweep from the right-hander sends the ball down to fine leg, and as the fielder tumbles over in stopping the ball, they take a second.
Chamu continues in the same vein of accuracy. Joyce nudges a straight ball softly to midwicket.
Joyce seizes on the merest hint of width outside off, angling his bat to get the ball through the gully. Panyangara at third man keeps them to one.
military-medium from Chamu, but he's giving the batsman nothing to hit. Stirling steps forward to defend.
ah, now there is width on this one. Stirling scythes the ball out to the cover sweeper.
Chamu trundles in and hits a length on middle and off. Joyce gets across and defends to leg.
full outside off, Joyce has a look and let it go.
Stirling waits on the ball to spin in to him, and then chops down on a cut to short third man.
this rolls just past the stumps! Stirling got right across to the off side, looking to push to leg, but the spin took the ball past his bat, and it then rolled just past the leg stump.
there's half an appeal from Nyumbu as Stirling is struck on the pads again. Too high.
swept hard down to long leg, but straight to the fielder.
turn and bounce outside off, but it's away from the left-hander and he can leave alone.
fuller this time, and Joyce stretches forward to defend.
driven hard for four! Stirling checked the stroke, but still got a very good connection on this full delivery outside off. The ball flies between extra cover and mid-off.

there's still no fielder at fine leg, and Chamu's line is too straight, allowing Stirling to glance the ball exactly in that direction. Panyangara is after it from square leg, and pulls it in just before the rope.
flicked through midwicket. The fielder fumbles in the outfield, and they're back for the second.
after his accurate start, Chamu is losing it a little. This is too wide outside off, and called by the Umpire.
Joyce stands at the crease and cracks this off the back foot, Nyumbu and Raza cut it off at cover.
pushed down the ground by Joyce. It's not hit very hard, but it goes straight and there's time for a single as the fielder at mid-off runs around.
full of length, just outside off, and Stirling defends.
Joyce takes a couple of steps down the track, but Nyumbu adjusts his length and the batsman has to defend.
the ball is caught at first slip, but Joyce hasn't hit it! This one really gripped the surface, turning and bouncing across him from leg stump.
Nyumbu twirls one down outside off, and Joyce lets this one go.
again the left-hander uses his feet, tapping to mid-on. The call for a single is immediate.
swept down to fine leg for one.
Joyce cuts, but the ball comes off the bottom edge and goes nowhere.
a touch short, and the ball is whipped out to deep square off the back foot. That's the fifty partnership, and there's a smattering of applause from the Ireland balcony.
Raza comes round the wicket to Joyce, who drives the ball hard back to him.
Joyce is on the drive again, but the ball goes to mid-off.
now Joyce stays back and aims to pull, but the spin on the ball straightens the angle too much and his pull rolls to mid-on.
squirted off the outer half of the bat, and the ball rolls out through cover.
nudged off his toes, and Stirling finds the gap at square leg. One more to the total.
Stirling steps right across to off and nudges off his hip. The ball bounces to the left of leg slip, and he palms it towards short fine leg.
Joyce skips down the track and checks his drive, the ball rolling to extra cover.
again Joyce uses his feet, but he can't get to the pitch of the delivery and the ball pops in the air towards extra cover. Well short of the fielder though.
much quicker through the air, and Joyce's defence is hurried.

crikey this has really shot off a length, and nearly taken Mutumbami out! Joyce left the ball alone, and it must have hit a crack outside off stump. It spat up towards Mutumbami's helmeted head, but somewhere he got his glove up in time.
this delivery behaves itself, and Joyce is forward to defend.
Raza comes round the wicket to Stirling, who defends to leg.
pushed back down the track, and the bowler fields cleanly.
again Stirling is well forward in defence, this time the ball rolls into the off side
much too full outside off, and Stirling seizes the opportunity to attack, clubbing a drive out to the extra cover boundary. One away from his fifty.
and there is the half-century, Stirling picking up a single with a drive down to long-on.
speared in quite quickly through the air, and Joyce defends back down the track.
swept very hard by Stirling, and the ball bursts through Mutombodzi's hands at square leg. It also got to him on a rather awkward bounce.
Stirling lunges forward and defends towards midwicket.
swept again, this time in the air, and the ball flies just over a leaping Mutombodzi at square leg! He's a tall man and he leapt up high, but couldn't get a hand to it.
now the batsman shuffles down the track, but he can't get to it and drives back to the bowler.
nudged down defensively towards point.

this has been caught at leg slip! Or has it? No, the umpire says. This ball pitched well outside off and spun in prodigiously to beat Stirling's forward defence. It beat bat, pad and stumps to get to leg slip. Zimbabwe thought there was an inside edge on it.
flicked off the toes, but straight to midwicket.
Joyce stays back this time, and cuts to point.
big spin! Joyce bent down low and wanted to drive through extra cover, but the ball fizzed away from him and was caught at slip. Lots of turn for the spinners already.

he's given him! Joyce must have been expecting more turn, but this one rushed on with the arm as Raza continued round the wicket to the left-hander. Ball missed bat, hit pad, and up went Umpire Matibiri's finger.
quick through the air, and O'Brien rushes his defence to leg.
a little shorter from Raza, and O'Brien steps back and across to defend.
driven firmly down to long-off, just the one.
O'Brien flicks off his pads, and the ball goes under a diving Nyumbu and down to fine leg.
edged! But it's wide of the slip fielder, and goes quickly down to the boundary. Stirling was looking to cut.
nicely full from Williams, and Stirling lunges forward to defend.
quicker from Williams, possibly the arm ball. Stirling defends from the crease.
cut in the air, but past the diving fielder at point! The cover sweeper cleans up
edged, and dropped! This was a tough chance for Mutumbami, the ball spinning sharply, but he spills it
nudged defensively into the covers.
pushed out through the covers, off the back foot now.
driven down to long-on.
O'Brien gets well forward to defend again.

oh dear, what's happened here? O'Brien stepped down the track and aimed a mighty swipe at the ball, but he got much more height than distance on the shot. Chamu Chibhabha ran across from long off, and seemed to get underneath it right in front of the sight screen ... but he spills it, and the ball bounces over the ropes. Worse, he seems to have hurt himself. He's down on the ground, and the physio has run out.
Stirling drives, and the ball takes the inside half of his bat to roll to midwicket. Raza dives to stop it.
eased down to long-off for one.
whipped hard off his legs, but straight to Chigumbura at midwicket.
a reverse sweep! But it comes off the hip as the ball scoots past the bat.
and now a top-edged sweep from the left-hander, the ball ballooning well over the keeper and slip.
speared down the leg side, and Mutumbami isn't across quickly enough to cut it off. Five wides.
the ball pops off the inside edge, hitting the pad as well, but it drops safely on the leg side.
Stirling drives to wide long on, and the placement is good enough to allow them time to rush back for a second run
Mutumbami has the bails off in a flash after ball passes bat, but O'Brien is safe
O'Brien skips out this time, but Raza arrows in a flat offspinner and he rushes to defend
Mutumbami has the bails off in a flash after ball passes bat, but O'Brien is safe
hot! Again O'Brien comes down the track, but this time he finds just the length he's looking for and lofts the ball cleanly over long on. Mid on was up, so the shot was on
pushed too far down the leg side by Raza, clear wide
tucked off the pads, but the shot finds midwicket
looped down on an off stump line, Williams coming round the wicket, and Stirling defends
forced off the back foot. Cover dives over the ball, but the sweeper cleans up
he's only in position for one ball as O'Brien gets off strike with a nurdle to midwicket.
ticked to short fine leg, another single taken
Mutumbami is having a cumbersome day in the field, and this ball spins past him as O'Brien sweeps at it. Down to fine leg for byes
nicely accurate from the left arm spinner, and Stirling defends back down the track
O'Brien is happy using his feet, but has to defend as he's not quite to the pitch
a little pause before delivery from Raza, and he then shoots down a quicker one that strikes the bottom of a defensive bat
pushed out softly into the covers
he's down the track again, and collects a single to long on

Raza has another! He continued round the wicket to the right hander, and this one spun in from what looked like an off stump line to strike the pad. Umpire Matibiri upholds the appeal, and a disappointed Stirling trudges off

sharp work from Waller! Balbirnie came down the track and defended to leg. Waller took it on the bounce and immediately throw the ball at the stumps. But his throw was slightly off. The batsman would have otherwise been out
chopped down to backward point, straight to the fielder
O'Brien gets right across to the off side before Williams has even released the ball, and glances to short fine leg
a misfield allows Balbirnie to get off strike. He drove square, towards point, where Chamu tumbled right over the ball
O'Brien sweeps, and a top edge loops down to fine leg
much quicker through the air, and Balbirnie picks him off the pads
the left hander is down the track to meet the ball on the full, and he drives down to long on
another little pause from Raza before he releases this quick offspinner, but it's a bit too short and O'Brien cuts him out into the deep
wrong line from the offspinner, coming round the wicket, and the ball spins down the leg side
Balbirnie uses his feet and flicks across the line to get the ball to deep midwicket
O'Brien is deep in his crease, aiming for placement on this shot in front of cover point for one
driven back past the bowler and down to long on for one
O'Brien drives hard, and a diving Waller at extra cover palms the ball towards mid off. The slight fumble allows a single
driven back to the right hand of Raza, and he cuts it off
O'Brien waits in the crease and nudges the ball through point for one
not much flight, but it's nicely accurate and Balbirnie defends
a paddle sweep loops high up in the air and bounces down to fine leg for a couple
much too short from the left arm spinner, and Balbirnie scythes a cut past point
this one goes on with the arm to cramp the right-hander's nudge to gully
Balbirnie drives, and mid off is very deep so they take a quick single
driven down the ground, long on comes in as they take a single

that will help Malcolm Waller's confidence! O'Brien drove the ball to his right at extra cover, and called quickly for a single. But the fielder rushed quickly to the ball, picked it up cleanly, and fired in a perfect throw to Mutumbami to catch Balbirnie short.
flicked to square leg to get off the mark
O'Brien stays deep in crease and whips off his hip to collect a single to midwicket
Wilson comes down the track, but he's not to the pitch and defends
the ball squirts off the outside edge and flies to gully, Sean Williams running across from short third man to field it
his shoots up again, perhaps off that crack, and flies past O'Brien's sweep and the keeper's gloves. That's the 150
O'Brien nudges softly to point
now he's down the track, and drives to long on
the ball comes off the inner half of the bat and rolls into space behind square on the leg side
nudged softly towards Chigumbura at midwicket
full and straight from the left arm spinner, and O'Brien defends

Wilson sweeps very hard at a flighted offspinner, and though he can't cover the bounce the ball loops off the top edge and down to the fine leg boundary. There's been rather a lot of top-edged sweeps today
Wilson is down the track, but Nyumbu draws his length back and the right-hander defends
chipped in the air, and a cry of "catch!" rings around the ground, but the fielder coming in from midwicket can't get close to the ball and it bounces well in front of him. It was Jongwe out there
nd now O'Brien drives one in the air, but it goes through the gap at cover and Raza rushes around from long off
et another top-edged sweep! But this delivery was much slower, and it's pulled in before the boundary
too short, too wide and Wilson leans back to cut the ball hard past point

huge strike! That's almost landed in the press box. O'Brien came down the track and swung cleanly through the line to send the ball straight back over the young bowler's head. He has three sixes now, no fours
a touch too short, but it's not punished as the ball is cut straight to Waller at extra cover
whipped off the pads, out to deep midwicket
there's a stifled appeal from the bowler for lbw as ball spins past bat on the outside edge, but it's well outside off
Wilson stays deep in his crease and flicks to leg, but Waller is across in a flash from midwicket to cut it off

this should have been a run out! Again Waller's fielding was the catalyst. Wilson stepped back and pulled very hard, but Waller sprinted to his right and dived down to stop the ball cleanly. His throw to Mutumbami was good, and Wilson, who had rushed down the track looking for a single, would have been well short. But Mutumbami fumbled the take and Wilson got home
nicely bowled first up, Nyumbu landing the offspinner on middle as O'Brien leans forward to defend
a touch shorter from the bowler, and this time O'Brien stays deep in his crease
pushed to the right of Chigumbura at cover, and he rushes across to cut it off
energetic fielding from Masakadza at midwicket. He dives onto a strong shot, and keeps it to a dot
driven into the leg side again, but this time it's straight enough to beat Masakadza. One to long on
a top-edged reverse sweep loops up over the keeper, but it's just a single
he small crowd think this is a caught and bowled, but it's a bump ball, Wilson driving back to the bowler
swept hard out into the deep, but along the ground and straight to the fielder
O'Brien comes down the track and the ball takes the inside edge of his defensive poke
now the left hander shuffles right across to the off side to change the angle, and picks up a single to midwicket
driven to the left of the bowler, but he's across in a flash to cut it off. Good energy from the youngster
this is pitched too short, and Wilson is unhurried as he leans back to pull. But Mutombodzi is out at deep midwicket to cut it off
driven back hard at the bowler, who stoops to stop the shot
no stopping that one. Wilson backs away to leg and slashes a cut past Ervine at point
and another boundary! Leaky stuff. This was a long half volley, and Wilson stepped to it to cream a drive through extra cover. His protection in the deep is all on the leg side
peared in flatter and faster, and it's defended back to the bowler
nudged to midwicket this time, and there's no run to be had
pushed defensively to cover to end the over
there's no long off in place for Masakadza, and so O'Brien steps down the pitch and chips the ball over mid off. The timing is really good, and the ball bounces once before crossing the boundary
a flat, fast ball is defended from the crease
odd-looking shot. O'Brien wanted to reverse sweep it, but when the ball came down wide of his legs he paddled it the other way to fine leg
pushed to cover off the back foot
committed fielding from Raza! Wilson dabbed the ball down to third man, beating the man at short third, and it looked like four. But Raza hared after it and timed his dive just right to cut it off.
nurdled off the pads for a single to end the over
and he's immediately hoicked out to wide long for four. O'Brien charged out of his crease and targeted the gap out there. That brings up the fifty partnership as well, at better than a run a ball
O'Brien brings up Ireland's 200 with a gentle drive through the gap at extra cover
worked off the pads, the ball goes through square leg
turn and bounce for Raza, but it's negotiated easily enough as O'Brien defends to point
turn and bounce for Raza, but it's negotiated easily enough as O'Brien defends to point
pushed down flat and fast, and down the leg side
riven hard off the back foot, but the shot is stopped by a diving Chigumbura at extra cover
Wilson jumps out of his crease to turn the ball into a full toss, and flays a drive down to long-off
O'Brien rushes out, but Masakadza seems to spot him coming and fires down a flatter, faster ball
again O'Brien charges, and the ball squirts off the inside edge to roll through square leg
very full indeed, almost a yorker, and it's dug out back to the bowler
Wilson stays deep in his crease and tries to find a gap on the off side, but he cuts to point
again Wilson looks to attack through the off side, but this time he bottom edges his cut and the ball goes nowhere
O'Brien brings up a 60-ball half-century by easing a straight ball out to deep midwicket for a single
driven back to the right of the bowler, who fields in his follow through
Wilson drives, but his shot pings the cover fielder
now he finds the gap with the reverse sweep! Well played. He had a man to beat at point, and did so easily
another reverse sweep, but this time it's aimed right at Nyumbu, who is at short third man

well held by Waller at long-off! O'Brien came down the track and chipped the ball, not looking to hit it too hard. He probably hit it a little too well, and Waller rushed in from long-off to hold the simple chance
arrowed down from around the wicket, and it's muscled straight to the midwicket fielder inside the circle
a sliced cut is stopped at backward point
Wellington sure isn't flighting them here, and a punted drive is stopped by Chigumbura at cover
driven hard back to the bowler, who can't get a hand to it - but the ball is stopped by the non-striker. It hit him as he hurried back into his crease
slapped hard towards cover, but Chigumbura dives to stop it cleanly. The effort is appreciated by the growing crowd of spectators
e's bowled a maiden! Again this is full outside off, but this time there's no timing on the drive and Chigumbura stops it easily at cover
Luke Jongwe comes back into the attack from the City End. His first spell was a bit of a mixed bag - he started well before things went awry

almost a run out! That was brave running from Ireland. Wilson clipped the ball out to midwicket, where Mutombodzi charged in and hurled a throw to Mutumbami. The keeper took the bails off immediately, but the square leg umpire reckoned Wilson was just home
Wilson drives, but it goes straight to Ervine at cover
a booming drive from Wilson to a ball pitched up outside off stump, but he's possibly tried to hit that too hard and ends up missing completely
full and straight, and the batsman eases a single to long-on
Jongwe pulls his length back a touch to O'Brien, who leans over and nudges the ball to midwicket, where Waller cuts it off
well bowled. Wilson leapt out of his crease, but Masakadza saw him coming and fired the ball quickly down the leg side. Wilson was lucky to get some pad on it, otherwise he might have been stumped
gain Wilson uses his feet, and though he's not to the pitch he manages a single to long-on
O'Brien sweeps, but it comes off the glove and trickles to short fine leg

Masakadza is really flinging the ball down flat and fast now, but he can't stop O'Brien, who comes down the track and is off the mark with a muscled heave out to wide long-on. Just the one bounce and it's over the rope
he follows that up with a more gentle single down the ground
a little too short from the bowler, and Wilson steps back to hammer a pull out to the fielder at deep midwicket
his first delivery is on a length outside off, and it's slapped out to deep cover for two

wrong length again from Panyangara. Wilson backed away to leg, opening up his stance, and swiped right through the line of a length delivery on middle. A solid connection sent the ball arcing over his head
the length is right this time, but the line is wrong as a very full ball shoots down the leg side
again Panyangara hits a length, but this time Wilson isn't in position and defends
Wilson gets right across to the off side, and Panyangara hurls down a yorker at his toes. Indeed, it's hit his boot and rolled to the leg side, allowing a quick leg bye

what a catch! Raza is a bundle of energy down at long on. He'd had a go trying to stop the six that Wilson hit down the ground earlier in the over, and now he's pulled off a stunning catch. O'Brien chipped the ball, possibly looking to go straighter than he did, and Raza sprinted in from long-on. The ball was dying on him all the way, but he leapt forward at the very last moment to pluck it out of the air inches off the ground. That's a great effort, and he celebrates by flinging the ball high in to the clear blue sky
short and fast. Wilson ducks into a pull, taking his eye off the ball, but he rolls his wrists and the ball flies safely down to fine leg

a huge mow across the line has sent the ball well beyond the wide long-on boundary! Wilson has rushed to a half-century. This was the slower ball from Jongwe, but it was on an easily length for the batsman to pick up, and he clearly spotted the variation
very full outside off this time, and it's dug out to point
again Jongwe targets the yorker, and Wilson misses his sweep to be struck on the pad. There's no appeal, as it was heading well down leg, and they take a leg bye
Mooney receives a short ball first up, but he's quickly back and across to shovel a pull out to deep square leg
another slower ball from Jongwe, but this one is right up to the batsman and zips underneath his attempted slog sweep. Fortunately for Wilson, it was wide of off
spanked to the extra cover boundary! Wilson cleared his left leg and cracked a full, wide ball right out of the middle. Cover sweeper and long off both ran around, but it was right between them
his first ball is right up to the batsman, who leans over it and finds a single just wide of midwicket
gun-barrel straight, right down the ground! Wilson picked this up so cleanly. He's playing a gem of an innings
now Wilson misses with the sweep. Wellington is bowling these darts with zero flight,and Wilson is struck on the pad outside leg
so he tries the reverse sweep, and though he gets a good connection Ervine gets a hand to it at short third man to keep them to one

great awareness from Masakadza! Mooney hammered a full one straight back down the pitch, but it clattered into the stumps and stopped dead. Wilson had charged down the pitch, looking for a single, and though he turned back quickly, Masakadza pounced on the ball in a flash and ripped one of the remaining stumps right out of the ground to run him out
oh dear, but he follows up that effort with a front-foot no ball. The batsmen had taken a single, Mooney having swiped the ball to midwicket, so it's Dockrell on strike
a somewhat ungainly heave from the new batsman, the ball floating up in the air and landing well in front of long- on. Some committed running brings Ireland two runs
Mooney backs away to leg as Jongwe fires down a short ball on off stump. The batsman slashes his cut up and over extra cover, and Waller runs in from the boundary to keep them to one
a decent yorker from Jongwe, and the best Dockrell can do with it is dig it out to long-on for a single
noticing the change in the field, Mooney looks for the scoop over the fine leg fielder but he can't connect. The ball comes off his pad and they rush through for a leg bye
well bowled once more by Jongwe, and again Dockrell can only dig the yorker out to long on, though he swung hard at the ball.
great delivery. Mooney backed away to leg, looking to attack the off side, but Jongwe fired through a quick yorker outside off that zipped right under the bat

brave delivery, a slower ball bouncer. Mooney backs away and it's so slower that he's got plenty of time to readjust. But he can't quite find the timing he wants, and gets one run with an uppish cut out to the cover sweeper
good start to the over for Panyangara, who slings down a yorker outside off. Mooney jams his bat down on it, and the batsmen hustle a single
great strike for a tailender! Dockrell backed away and Panyangara followed him with a bouncer, but the batsman committed to a stroke and sent the ball down the ground with a tennis forehand
much fuller from the bowler this time, and Dockrell punts him down to long on for one
nicely bowled. Another great yorker to the left hander, and it zips right under his swinging blade. A heave and a miss
another fine death delivery, but this time Mooney lays bat on the yorker and they take a run as the ball rolls to cover
Dockrell backs right away, trying to target the cover boundary, but Panyangara follows him with a yorker. It's dug out into the off side, and they sprint through for one

inn2.comm: well, Chamu thought about having a drive at the very first delivery, which was full and wide outside off, but opted to leave it alone at the very last moment.
Mooney's second ball is slower, and possibly a cutter. In any case, it's held up on the wicket and Chamu's forcing stroke off the back foot comes much to early, the ball rolling to leg.
Mooney errs in line, pushing the ball down the leg side.
that's better from Ireland's opening seamer. A full length delivery targets the stumps, and Chamu has to press forward to defend.
effort ball from Mooney, but it's angled down the leg side and it comes off the batsman's thigh pad, evading the diving wicketkeeper and rolling away for four.
huge shout for lbw! The bowler, slips, keeper, everyone went up when this length delivery struck Chamu on the pads. But it looked high, even from up here, and it's not given.
first runs off the bat, and they come via a cut shot down to third man. It was short and wide, and the shot was on, but he didn't quite middle it.
Chamu flicks a straight delivery off his pads, and they take a single as the man at deep midwicket runs in.

another lbw shout! This one also looked too high. Mutumbami was distracted by the shout and didn't hear Chamu's call for a single, the ball having rolled to gully, but there's no harm done in the end.
full and on his legs, and it's clipped down to long leg for a couple.
chipped in the air, but safely in the gap between mid-off and extra cover. The fielder is after it, and keeps them to two

this is a much better shot, and it's all along the ground. Murtagh has been a little too straight in this over, and again he's strayed onto Chibhabha's legs. The ball is met with a flick of the wrists and the ball races to the wide long-on boundary.
Chibhabha shuffled right across to the off side before this ball bowled, and though he misses with another attempted flick they sneak a leg bye.
Mooney hits a length, just outside off, and Mutumbami's nudge dribbles to point. The batsman didn't move his feet at all.

much better footwork this time, and it's to a full ball on leg stump. Chamu whips his wrists across the ball and doesn't bother to keep the shot down, the ball bouncing out to the deep midwicket boundary.
short and wide this time, and the ball is met with a flashing cut. But the placement is not quite there, and third man cleans up.
Mutumbami stands tall to force a back of a length delivery away into the covers, and as the fielder there fumbles,  they steal a single.
a full toss from Mooney, and it was also possibly a slower ball. Chamu didn't read it either way, and taps the ball gently back to the bowler.
glanced off his pads and down to long leg for one.
well bowled, fullish of length and seaming in from just outside off. Chibhabha meets it with stooping defence.

and he edges it just where the fielder has been moved from! This was a shade shorter, and Chamu tried to power it away off the back foot, but could only managed a thick edge. But it flew through second slip, where there was no fielder, and down to the boundary.
Murtagh pushes his length a little closer to the batsman, and the ball is driven straight to mid off.
Chamu rides the bounce on a back of a length delivery to guide it to point.
past the outside edge! Murtagh floated this one out full and wide, and Chamu flashed hard off the front foot. Couldn't get close to it.
and ball goes past bat once more to end the over, though it looked as though Chamu deliberately drew his bat inside this length delivery outside off.
nicely driven by Mutumbami, but the ball rolls straight to the mid-on fielder.
nurdled into the leg side for one. Mutumbami read the length early, getting across and into position to get the ball to midwicket.
another big shot from Chamu, another play and miss! The ball was short and wide, so the shot was on, but it seamed in off the track and also possibly kept a little low to beat his bottom edge.
just short of a good length, and Chamu is back and across to defend.
Mooney lands this delivery much closer to the batsman, who leans into a drive but sends the ball straight to mid off.
Chamu isn't sure whether to pull this one of flick it off his hip, and ultimately does neither, the ball hitting the toe end of his bat and falling at his feet.
on a length and rising above off stump. Mutumbami defends the ball under his eyes.
Murtagh pushes this one a little wider outside off, and the batsman is able to guide it down to third man for one.
fuller this time from the right-arm seamer, and it's met with the full face of the bat. The ball rolls to mid on.
well bowled. This would have hit the top of middle, had the batsman not got right behind the delivery with his forward defence.
Murtagh continues to plug away on this full-ish length. This delivery lands a little wider of off, but it's not there to be driven and is defended into the covers.
and again. Not much that you can do with these sorts of deliveries against the new ball. The ball lands on a length just outside off, and Chamu leans forward to defend it.
nicely played. Mutumbami breaks the shackles with a neat paddle-flick off his hips that brings four to fine leg. Wrong line from Mooney.
and he follows that up by dabbing a length delivery outside off through the gully. Chamu calls quickly for the single.
nudged to the gully once again, but this time the fielder at point is very quickly across to cut it off.
floated up full and wide by Mooney, possibly trying to tempt the batsman into an uppish drive. But Chamu keeps his cover drive along the carpet, and they pick up two
Mooney pulls his length back, and Chamu's nudge to leg goes nowhere.
that's gone somewhere! This delivery was full, and Chamu leaned forward to drive it handsomely past Ed Joyce at mid-on. Right out of the middle

edged up and over the solitary slip! Mutumbami rushed out at this delivery and looked as though he wanted to heave it over mid-on, but it bounced on him and took the top edge. A leaping Gary Wilson at first slip couldn't get close.
in the air once again! This time Mutumbami drives square of the wicket, but slices underneath the ball. Fortunately for him he gets enough on it to get the ball up and over point.
aggressive batting from Mutumbami, who walks down the pitch at this length delivery. But he can't get close enough to drive it.

gone this time! And this was a defensive stroke. Mutumbami shuffled right across and tried to work this to leg, but the ball took the leading edge and popped straight to Porterfield at point. Ireland have the breakthrough.
Murtagh beats the edge! This hit the seam and left the batsman, who poked inside the line. Not a lot of bounce on the delivery, and it bounces in front of the keeper.
Ervine steps forward to get right behind a solid forward defensive.
his first delivery is lobbed down on a length just outside off, and Chamu defends it from the crease.
a touch straighter this time, and the batsman shuffles across to work the ball to midwicket
a similar line, but this is a little shorter and Chamu flicks to leg off the back foot. He still can't find the gap there.

this is full, and it's driven back to the bowler. He picks it up in his follow through and hurls it back at the stumps, accidentally hitting the batsman in the process. His apology is immediate, he was aiming for the stumps.
a misfield by Mooney at mid off! Chamu's off drive was a powerful one, but it was hit straight at the fielder. Somehow, it slipped past him and sped away to the boundary to bring up Zimbabwe's fifty.

gone this time! O'Brien pulled his length back, and also got this delivery to leave the batsman off the pitch. Chamu poked at it, and feathered an edge through to the keeper. O'Brien is ecstatic, he runs into the covers with his arms aeroplaning and is mobbed by his team-mates. That's his 200th wicket for Ireland, across all formats.
his first ball is short, and pulled high in the air towards wide long-on. There's no fielder out there, but the shot isn't middled either and it plugs in the outfield.
much fuller, and this one is flicked off his toes out to deep square leg.
McBrine lands his offspinner on middle and off, and Williams is watchfully forward in defence.
swiped away to deep midwicket! Williams picked up the length early, and read the line nicely as well, using his bottom hand to power the shot.
Williams is looking to get a move on here. Now he backs away to off and forces the ball into the covers off the back foot. Straight to the fielder.
flatter and faster from McBrine, and Williams drives it softly to mid-off.
his first delivery is on a good length, on middle and off, and Ervine flicks it to midwicket
Ervine is across to the off side again, but this time his nudge to leg goes wide enough to the left of the midwicket fielder to allow a single.
wobbling away from the left-hander outside off. Williams gets across to cover the movement and defends to short extra cover.
Williams drives, but the ball flies off the inside edge and rolls to short fine leg. O'Brien has his hands on his head.

shot! This was floated up a little too full, and Ervine just stepped forward and presented the full face of the bat. The ball beat O'Brien's outstretched boot and went straight of the man at mid-off, bouncing away for four.
flicked off the legs this time, and the placement is good enough for a sharp single.
Ervine tucks a full ball on his toes to the left of the man at midwicket, and they manage another single.
defended solidly into the covers.
oh dear, what's happened here? Williams pushed it softly to cover again, but McBrine ran around to stop it off even as the cover fielder ran in to do the same. They collided and allowed a single.
too straight, and it's swiped away to deep midwicket for a couple.
McBrine is targeting the pads of the batsmen from around the wicket, and this one is worked to leg again for a single.
he's outside off to end the over, Ervine defending to extra cover.
what sort of shot is that? Williams wanted to paddle sweep, but the ball kicked at him from outside off, taking the top edge. It lands short of point
Williams stays deep in his crease and drives back to the bowler.
too short from Dockrell, and Williams pulls him out to deep midwicket. There's a fumble on the boundary, and they're back for the second.
a cut this time, but it finds the cover sweeper.
nicely played by Ervine, a late little dab that sends the ball down to third man.
turn and bounce for Dockrell, but his line is too straight and the ball bounces off Ervine's hip.
pushed down the leg side, and the batsman gets a little tickle on it. A good diving stop at short fine leg saves runs.
worked to leg again, but this time it's straighter.
driven down to long-off for a calm single.
Williams has the reputation as a better sweeper, but Ervine has middled this shot. Very well played, he got down low and crunched a sweep out to deep square, beating the fielder at midwicket.
flicked into the leg side to end the over.
flat and fast from Dockrell. Ervine is back when he should have been forward, but gets the bat down in time.
shot! Ervine steps out and meets this ball on the half volley, lifting it high over long-off for six.
driven uppishly, but in the gap to long-on.
worked to midwicket
again Williams looks to flick the ball with the spin into the leg side.
good use of the feet from Williams, and though he hits the ball straight back over Dockrell's head he doesn't quite middle it.
Williams sweeps, and gets a good connection - but there's a sweeper out at deep midwicket.
full on middle and off, and it's driven back to the bowler.
this has missed everything! Ervine came forward to defend but the ball rushed through the gap between bat and pad. It also beat the keeper, and they take a bye.
Williams stays deep in his crease and pushes the ball back to the bowler.
reverse sweep, and it lands just short of the point fielder! Williams couldn't get right underneath this shot, but fortunately for him it landed short of a diving point fielder.
a touch too short from the offspinner, and it's slapped hard out to extra cover.
Dockrell loops one down full on his legs, and short fine leg runs in to stop any thoughts of a leg bye.
Ervine misses the sweep, and O'Brien collects. No run.
flicked to leg again, and it goes straight to square leg.
driven hard back to the bowler.
speared down the leg side by Dockrell,a clear wide.
full and straight, giving the batsman nothing to work with, and he drives back to the bowler.
Ervine looks to work the ball to leg, and Dockrell leaps in excitement as the ball strikes the pad. Well outside off.
Williams steps forward to drive to mid-off.
Stirling twirls one down full on off stump, and Williams drives back down the pitch.
well swept by the left-hander. He got down low on one knee and connected well, beating a diving Ed Joyce at short fine leg.
another sweep, this one goes in the air towards deep midwicket but falls well short of the fielder.
Ervine lunges forward to smother the spin in defence.
driven down to long-off for a single to end the over.
Dockrell is on the mark straight away, and the ball comes off Ervine's pad before rolling to fine leg.
this turns sharply in to Williams as he steps back to cut, cramping his shot. The ball rolls to cover.
more turn and bounce, this one zipping in from outside off to hit the pad. But it's hit him well outside off.
a touch short outside off, and Williams leans back to force the ball to deep cover.
too straight this time, and Ervine lays bat on a leg glance to collect two to fine leg.
spinning down the leg side this time, and the umpire signals wide.
an appeal for caught behind! Ervine wanted to slice this away off the back foot, but the ball rushed past him. O'Brien appeals, but the umpire isn't interested.
driven with the spin through the covers.
fuller and straighter from Stirling, and Williams' drive finds long-on.
looped down wide of off stump, cracked through the covers.
Ervine stays deep in his crease to punch the ball to long-off.
swept hard by Williams, but straight to the man at deep midwicket. All along the ground.
big appeal for a stumping! The ball gripped and turned past Ervine's outside edge, and O'Brien broke the stumps immediately. But his back foot was grounded the entire time.
Dockrell hasn't quite got his length right after drinks. This sits up outside off, and he's fortunate that Williams' cut is stopped by the cover sweeper.
driven fluently, but straight to mid-off.
Williams leaves this one alone outside off.
and another leave. Nicely judged, the ball went straight on with the arm.
Dockrell adjusts his line a little, landing this one straighter, and Williams stretches forward to defend.
looped up wide of off, Williams lunges out and threads the gap at cover with a drive.
Williams drives with the spin, but a diving cover fielder cuts the shot off.
swept hard, the batsman rolling his hands over the shot to keep it down.
speared down the leg side, called wide.
Ervine sweeps, but the ball shoots off the toe end and trickles back to the bowler.
softly defended back to the bowler.
paddle swept by Ervine, and Mooney is after it from short fine leg ... he puts in a dive right next to the boundary, but he can't get there in time.
quicker and flatter through the air, the ball goes on with the arm and takes the inside half of a defensive bat.
extra bounce for Dockrell outside off, but Williams rides it well and hacks a cut out to the cover sweeper.
Ervine shuffles down the track but he can't get to the pitch of the ball and hurries his defence.
the ball grips and spins in sharply, striking Ervine on the pad. There's some excitement from Dockrell, but it's outside off.
a top-edged paddle sweep pops up over the keeper and bounces down to fine leg.
flicked with the spin down to long-on.
dip, grip and spin for Dockrell. But Williams is right behind the ball to defend it.
twirled down full outside off, and it's driven to long-off for one.
a little flatter through the air, and Williams steps back in his crease to defend.
another top-edged sweep, and this one flies high in the air towards long leg ... but it lands safely, and bounces wide of a sprinting fielder to go for four. Williams put everything into the shot.
driven hard, and though cover dives he can't stop the single.
Ervine goes back and across to work a single to long-on.
Williams stretches well forward, getting right to the pitch, and pings long-off for a single.
his first delivery, a gentle loosener, is worked off the pads to square leg.
a very similar ball, O'Brien starting with a wicket-to-wicket line, and it's flicked square again.
wider of off this time, and Williams cuts in front of square for a single.
too straight from O'Brien, and Ervine just has to get bat on it to pick up two to fine leg.
full and wide outside off, and Ervine leans into one of those languid drives to add another run to the score.
a crouching Williams angles his bat to work a length delivery through point, and they amble through for another one.
no holding back from Williams! He jumps down the track and crunches this straight back over the bowler's head
now Williams leans back and chops the ball through extra cover
driven back to the bowler
Ervine sweeps, and though it goes uppishly as the ball dies well short of the deep square leg fielder

and he's gone! Williams wasn't going to be held back by fielders in the deep, but he's given his wicket away with one aggressive stroke too many. He jumped out at the offspinner again, and wanted to go over long-on. But he didn't get all of it, and Wilson Joyce, who had been at slip, settles under the catch. Easily taken.
Tino is off the mark in confident style! The ball was looped down very full and quite wide too, but he stretched forward and met it with a flashing blade. They sprint back for the third

great running, but watch out for that hamstring Ervine. Tino stands tall and slaps a short ball through cover point. It's stopped before the boundary, but the batsmen sprint through for an all run four
O'Brien pushes his length slightly fuller and Mutombodzi defends from the crease
a slower ball from big Kevin, but it seems the batsman has read it as he steps forward and nudges to extra cover along the ground
pushed through quicker this time, and wider of off. Tino raises his bat to leave
wristy, hopping defence from the right hander as he covers a touch of extra bounce off a length
a bumper to finish the over, and Tino seemed to take his eye off it as he swivelled to pull. The ball takes the splice, but falls safely at short fine leg
some tired fielding down at long-on allows the batsmen through for two. Tino flicked with the spin, but the ball bounced down straight towards the fielder, who wasn't in very quickly
outside off, and the offspinner is chopped down to gully
Tino shuffles across and finds a small gap between square leg and midwicket with a nurdle to leg
McBrine comes over the wicket, landing the ball on leg stump, and Ervine defends
pushed softly back to the bowler once again
Ervine moves to 49 with a drive down the ground. He drove the ball close to McBrine, but the bowler couldn't get down in time to stop it
O'Brien finds a hint of wobble, and a nicely straight line. Ervine leans forward to defend
dug in by O'Brien, but the ball doesn't get up at all and it scoots underneath Ervine's swivel-pull. The keeper fumbles, but not enough to allow a bye

fifty for Ervine, from 58 deliveries. He gets to the mark with a tap-and-run shot to midwicket. He called straight away, and the fielder at midwicket inside the circle may have been under a little pressure. He fumbled slightly, and the batsmen eased through for what could have been a very tight single
rising up off a length, though at no great pace, and Tino nudges defensively to leg
very full on off stump, and driven to mid off, who is inside the circle.
here's a nice sound off the bat as Tino pulls a short one out to deep midwicket, but he's also found the fielder with the shot so it's just one
McBrine comes round the wicket, and the ball is turned with the spin to midwicket
glanced to short fine leg this time. Ervine calls immediately for the run, and they're safely home
eased down the ground to long-off
looped down very slowly, and Tino responds with a chip down the ground. I'm not sure if it was deliberate, but it lands safely in front of the fielder
swept against the spin, but well struck, and the man at long leg has to move quickly to cut it off
Tino fetches a full ball outside off into the leg side with plenty of bottom hand, but he finds the man at midwicket inside the circle.
Ervine stretches well forward to smother this back down the track
imploring appeal from Dockrell as Ervine is hit on the pad, from around the wicket, but the umpire is unmoved
now Dockrell fires one underneath an attempted sweep, and O'Brien whips the bails off. Again no love from the umpire
pushed down quickly outside off, left alone
turned, with the spin, into the leg side. No run
and Dockrell completes the maiden, the first of the innings, as the ball pops up off the bat/pad and rolls into the leg side.
short and wide outside off, and Tino middles a shot out to the cover sweeper. He hits it so hard that it pops out of the fielder's hands, and they take the second
Murtagh adjusts, going much fuller, and Tino aims a wristy drive at short extra cover
on a length, and tailing in ever so slightly. Tino stands at the crease and angles the ball to the backward point fielder
Tino takes a couple of steps down the track and clips into the leg side. The ball goes just wide of midwicket, and Ervine calls him through for a single
full and straight from Murtagh. Ervine uses his bottom hand to work the ball to leg, but he can't beat the field

lunging defence from Ervine as Murtagh aims full and straight. The ball bounces back to him, and he kicks it up once, twice, three times before throwing it back to the umpire to draw some appreciative cheers from the crowd

Tino has very nearly run past this one from Dockrell, but manages to lay bat on it at the last moment to collect a single to fine leg. The bowler spotted him coming down the wicket and speared the ball down the leg side
a touch too full from Dockrell, and Ervine is able to drive to long on without fuss.
Mutombodzi is a busy-looking cricketer, and he rotates the strike again with a flashing cut into the deep
floated up on middle and off, and Ervine turns the ball gently into the leg side.
yet more flight from Dockrell, if there was a breeze he'd be hanging the ball in it. Ervine comes forward in smothering defence
Ervine uses his bottom hand to shift this ball through square leg, and collects another single.
Ervine stands at the crease to defend a length delivery. O'Brien is still up to the stumps
accurate stuff from Murtagh, who gives the left-hander no width at all to work with. More defence
uppish! Ervine was aiming to push this length delivery through cover, but was too early on the stroke. The ball went to ground about two metres in front of extra cover
a touch too straight, and Ervine is able to find a single wide of midwicket

up and over long leg! One bounce and over the ropes. This wasn't all that short, but Tino read the length very early and picked the ball up with a sort of scooped pull. Kevin O'Brien is down at fine leg, but it was placed wide of him
Murtagh ends with a full ball that's nudged softly to midwicket
chipped up and over the bowler's head for four! A nicely controlled stroke from Ervine. Mid-on and mid-off were up, and he beat them both with ease.
O'Brien responds with an effort ball, a little shorter, that beats Ervine's pull to strike him in the stomach
fuller this time, but slipping down leg and they take a leg bye off Ervine's pad.
very full and quite slow through the air. Tino drives gently to mid on
a little wider of off stump, and the ball is driven to point with an angled bat
where was Tino trying to hit this one? An almighty heave, but he doesn't get near it. The ball hits the pad, outside leg, and they run a leg bye. Mind the windows Tino ...
has he caught this? The ball shoots past Ervine and O'Brien holds onto it at the second attempt. Mooney is running down the pitch in celebration as Ireland appeal, but Umpire Matibiri says no!
Mooney aims this one at Ervine's pads, and he's flicked it to deep midwicket
Tino chops down on a cut outside off, and as an awkward bounce induces a fumble at point they snatch a single
Ervine steps away to leg, staying in the crease with O'Brien up to the stumps, and punches the ball to long on

off the inside edge! Tino wanted to crash this through the covers, but the ball came in to him, shooting off the inside edge past the stumps and down to fine leg. That was very close, and Niall O'Brien has his hands on his head in disbelief
a bottom-handed slug sends the ball down to long on, one more to the total.
Ervine steps away to leg as O'Brien bounds to the crease, glancing a full ball down to fine leg for one.

what a catch! This is a really special effort. Tino set himself to flick to leg but was too early into the shot. The ball looped in the air but seemed to be heading for empty space on the off side ... until Dockrell, who was at cover, charged round and timed his dive to snatch it mere inches from the turf. O'Brien certainly appreciates the effort, and celebrates the wicket with arms outstretched
on a length, just outside off, and Raza leaves it alone. That wasn't all that far away from his off stump, though in hindsight it seems well judged
fuller from the medium-pacer, and Raza leans forward to drive to mid-off
Raza leans forward and presents the full face of the bat to drive to mid-on.
a slashing cut is well stopped at point. It's Dockrell in that position, and he did well to get down and get a hand to a strong shot
worked off the pads, the ball runs past midwicket and the batsmen take a sedate single

Raza has demolished the stumps at the non-striker's end! I'm not sure there's a need for these sorts of singles. Raza nudged the ball towards point, where the fielder swooped very quickly. But Ervine called for the run, and Raza sprinted for the other end. Straight for the other end, and through the stumps as he leapt to make his ground.
full on off stump, and it's punted back to the bowler on the bounce
angling down the leg side, but Ervine can't get the connection he wants, and O'Brien sprints across from his position at the stumps to field the ball

dropped! A really tough chance goes down. Ervine wanted to run this full ball down to third man, but got a little edge on it. O'Brien is right up to the stumps, so it was a very difficult chance. The ball goes in to his gloves and straight out again, and Mooney is down on his haunches clutching his head
driven down to long off, and they trot through for a single
O'Brien seams it in off the pitch to beat Ervine's attempted nurdle to leg and hit him on the pads. There's no appeal, as it was high and probably headed down the leg side
this time Ervine does lay bat on the flick to leg, and they take a single as fine leg runs round to field the ball
the ball comes in to Raza with the angle, and he's up on his toes to work it through square leg

Ervine backs away, giving himself room, and threads the gap in the covers with a powerful drive. But there's some good work from Ireland too, Mooney sprinting around from mid off and getting a palm to the ball to stop what would have been a certain boundary
nicely straight, a wicket to wicket line, and Ervine can only push it back to the bowler
Ervine is looking for a big shot here. Again he backs away to leg, but O'Brien follows him and his glance goes straight to midwicket
Raza takes his bottom hand off this drive, but it goes along the ground and through the gap at cover, and the batsmen take a single to bring up Zimbabwe's 200
Ervine shuffles to the off side this time, but the ball hits the splice of his attempted flick to leg and goes nowhere
Ervine is having a bit of a tough time finding his timing on all these shots. Now he tries to pull, but the ball rushes on to him, hits him in the stomach, and rolls to point
a little too straight, and Ervine lays bat to ball to collect a single to fine leg
Mooney aims this one full, right up at the stumps, and Raza digs it out to midwicket
a shy at the stumps! Raza bent down to drive, and the ball went towards mid off. Raza wanted the run, but it was very tight indeed, and had the throw been on target he'd have been out by yards.
a play and a miss outside off! Raza laid into a drive to a full ball outside off, but the ball rushed past his outside edge
punched down the ground off the back foot. Dockrell dives but can't stop the shot
Ervine jumps down the wicket to a flighted delivery, but it dips on him and he must defend
slapped hard down to long off, Ervine clearing his front leg to set up the shot
urn and bounce - especially bounce - outside off stump and Raza has to get up on his toes to run the ball to gully.
a little too short from Dockrell, and Raza cuts out to the cover sweeper.
Murtagh comes back into the attack, and starts with a back of a length delivery on middle and leg that Raza hops over to find a single to fine leg
hat'll help Zimbabwe's nerves. Murtagh tries a short one, but Ervine is back and waiting for it, and middles a pull just behind square on the leg side
and another! This was much fuller from Murtagh, but it was angled in to Ervine's legs and he sent it to the wide long on boundary with a neat little chip. Good, clean hit
nothing clean about this though! Ervine backs away, with O'Brien up to the stumps, and aims to smite this down the ground. But he swings at fresh air and the ball just past the off stump
Ervine now misses an attempted glance to leg and wears one on the hip
a big heave to leg off a ball rising outside off stump, but the shot is bottom edged and the ball goes nowhere

in the air ... and safe! Raza jumped down the wicket and aimed for long on, but the ball skewed off the bat as he sliced underneath it and flew in the air towards wide long off. The fielders at deep cover, long off and extra cover all run for it, but it falls right in between them
a little short this time, and it's bunted down to long on, all along the ground
too short again from Dockrell, and Ervine rocks back to muscle a pull out to deep square leg. He didn't bother keeping it down, and the ball bounces once before the rope
pushed through full and fast, and it's defended back down the track
Ervine jumps down the track this time, and clubs the ball down to long off. A great one-handed stop from O'Brien, who was helped by the friendly bounce, saves a certain boundary
Raza's angled bat sends the ball down to short third man, and Ervine calls him through for one
Raza backs away and cuts a ball off his stumps, out to sweeper cover
that's a big one! Ervine jumped out like a left-handed Trumper and met the ball on the half volley with a full swing of the blade. Six from the moment he hit it
Ervine moves into the 90s with a controlled sweep out to deep midwicket
Stirling darts one in just outside off, and Raza waits on it to run a single through backward point
Ervine waits for the ball to spin and cuts, but straight to point
Stirling ends with a full, straight delivery and Ervine is slightly off balance as he bends down to defend
a very cheeky little late dab from Raza sends the ball rolling down to third man. It's quite fine, but the third man fielder is able to get across quickly enough to save the boundary
two more, and that's some hard running from the Zimbabwe pair. Raza punched the ball through gully off the back foot, and it only looked like one but they pushed hard for the second

Raza is really pushing it here! He tries another late cut, but this is very late indeed and O'Brien looks annoyed at himself not for catching it - the ball popped just past his outside glove as he stood up to the stumps. Raza then pushes hard for what seemed an unlikely second, and gets home safely in the end!
wo more! This time he drives through extra cover, and as the sweeper comes in calls for the second. Ervine is blowing hard at the other end
ah, just the single this time. Raza cuts a short ball up and over point, but it plugs in the outfield and third man is in in a flash
he fifty partnership comes up with a wide, Murtagh hurling a yorker length delivery down the leg side
Murtagh hits a length outside off as Ervine backs away, the left-hander bottom edging a tired looking shot into the covers
not that Raza minds! He steps back and carves a length delivery very high over wide long on for a huge six. He held nothing back in the shot
much fuller from O'Brien and Raza digs it out to long on for a single
Ervine leans forward to drive a full delivery, but he aims his shot straight to Dockrell in the covers
O'Brien arrows one down the leg side to add to the extras column
dabbed to cover point. Ervine wants a single, but there is none
O'Brien lands the ball on a length outside off, and Ervine swipes across the line to find a single to deep midwicket
full outside off stump, and Raza drives to the cover fielder inside the ring

Ervine steps back to shellack a length delivery out to deep cover, where the ball very nearly bounces up and over the fielder charging in from the rope. But he sticks out a hand to stop it, and they only take a single

Raza isn't holding back! He's a team man, and the team comes first. Mooney floated down a gentle half volley outside off, and Raza crunched an inside out drive over extra cover. One bounce, two bounces and four. Ervine better get a move on if he wants his ton

caught in the deep! Raza stepped back and targeted the leg side this time, picking up a length delivery. He hit the ball really well, but also placed it straight into the hands of the man at deep midwicket
nd Chigumbura slices the ball up and over Wilson's head! The shot, to a wide ball outside off, was top edged and the ball flew well over the fielder, bouncing down to third man
on a length, just outside off, and Ervine punches to point
gosh, this one has slipped out of Mooney's sweaty hand. It loops way down the leg side, a huge wide
four runs for Ervine! Mooney pulled his length back, but Ervine met the ball with a front-foot pull and picked the gap at wide long on to perfection
play and a miss outside off! Chigumbura was looking to guide this length delivery down to third man, but the ball zipped past him
nudged into the leg side, but off the splice and there's no space for a single
a slower ball from O'Brien, and Chigumbura bends down low to sweep it to fine leg
a length delivery is driven into the covers, but without much timing
it's short, and pulled, and for a moment the crowd think that's his ton, but the fielder at fine leg stops it on the bounce
full, on his legs, and Elton keeps the strike with a glance to fine leg
Chigumbura drives, but it's just to the left of mid off and the fielder cuts it off. Ervine calls him through for a single
very full, and aimed right at middle stump. Ervine can only dig it out back down the pitch

he's done it! Ervine backs away, picks up the length quickly and flat-bats the ball straight down the ground. Mid on can't cut it off, and he gets four runs to win the game for his team and register his second ODI ton. Ervine raises his arms, and he's embraced by his captain
